intro: Crepis runcinata var. glauca, commonly known as the glaucous sowthistle, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It typically grows to a height of 20–60 cm, featuring basal rosettes of silver-green, hairy leaves. The plant produces small, yellow flowers arranged in a single terminal head, which bloom from late spring to early summer. Its leaves are often covered in a waxy coating, giving them a bluish-gray appearance. This variety is often found in disturbed soils, along roadsides, and in meadows.
